abstract: An object that stores information that’s used to generate printed output.
overview:
## Overview

A shared [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSPrintInfo] object is automatically created for an app and is used by default for all printing jobs for that app. The printing information in an [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSPrintInfo] object is stored in a dictionary. To access the standard attributes in the dictionary directly, this class defines a set of keys and provides the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSPrintInfo/dictionary()] method. You can also initialize an instance of this class using the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSPrintInfo/init(dictionary:)] method.

You can use this dictionary to store custom information associated with a print job. Any non-object values should be stored as [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Foundation/NSNumber] or [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Foundation/NSValue] objects in the dictionary. See [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Foundation/NSNumber] for a list of types which should be stored as numbers. For other non-object values, use the [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Foundation/NSValue] class.

To store custom information that belongs in printing presets you should use the dictionary returned by the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSPrintInfo/printSettings] method.

# NSPrintInfo

**Class**

An object that stores information that’s used to generate printed output.

## Declaration

```swift
class NSPrintInfo
```

## Overview

A shared [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSPrintInfo] object is automatically created for an app and is used by default for all printing jobs for that app. The printing information in an [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSPrintInfo] object is stored in a dictionary. To access the standard attributes in the dictionary directly, this class defines a set of keys and provides the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSPrintInfo/dictionary()] method. You can also initialize an instance of this class using the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSPrintInfo/init(dictionary:)] method.

You can use this dictionary to store custom information associated with a print job. Any non-object values should be stored as [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Foundation/NSNumber] or [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Foundation/NSValue] objects in the dictionary. See [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Foundation/NSNumber] for a list of types which should be stored as numbers. For other non-object values, use the [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Foundation/NSValue] class.

To store custom information that belongs in printing presets you should use the dictionary returned by the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSPrintInfo/printSettings] method.

## Creating the Printing Information Object

- **shared**: The shared printing information object.
- **init(dictionary:)**: Returns a printing information object initialized with the parameters in the specified dictionary.
- **init()**: Creates a printing information object.
- **init(coder:)**: Creates a printing information object from data in an unarchiver.

## Managing the Printing Rectangle

- **paperSize**: The size of the paper.
- **topMargin**: The top margin to the specified size.
- **bottomMargin**: The height of the bottom margin.
- **leftMargin**: The width of the left margin.
- **rightMargin**: The width of the right margin.
- **imageablePageBounds**: The imageable area of a sheet of paper specified by the print info.
- **orientation**: The orientation attribute.
- **NSPrintInfo.PaperOrientation**: Constants that describe the orientation of printing on a page.
- **paperName**: The name of the currently selected paper size.
- **NSPrinter.PaperName**: The type you use to specify the name of a type of paper.
- **localizedPaperName**: The human-readable name of the currently selected paper size, suitable for presentation in user interfaces.

## Pagination

- **horizontalPagination**: The horizontal pagination mode.
- **verticalPagination**: The vertical pagination to the specified mode.
- **NSPrintInfo.PaginationMode**: Constants that specify the different ways in which an image is divided into pages.

## Positioning the Image on the Page

- **isHorizontallyCentered**: A Boolean value that indicates whether the image is centered horizontally.
- **isVerticallyCentered**: A Boolean value that indicates whether the image is centered vertically.

## Specifying the Printer

- **printer**: The printer object to be used for printing.
- **NSPrinter**: An object that describes a printer’s capabilities.

## Controlling Printing

- **jobDisposition**: The action specified for the job.
- **NSPrintInfo.JobDisposition**: Constants that specify values for the print job disposition.
- **setUpPrintOperationDefaultValues()**: Validates the attributes encapsulated by the print info.

## Accessing the Print Info Dictionary

- **dictionary()**: Returns the print info’s dictionary that contains the printing attributes.

## Print Settings Convenience Methods

- **isSelectionOnly**: A Boolean value that indicates whether only the currently selected contents should be printed.
- **scalingFactor**: The current scaling factor.

## Accessing Core Printing Information

- **printSettings**: A mutable dictionary containing the print settings from Core Printing.
- **NSPrintInfo.SettingKey**: The type you use to specify a print info setting key.
- **pmPrintSession()**: Returns a Core Printing object configured with the print info’s session information.
- **pmPageFormat()**: Returns a Core Printing object configured with the print info’s page format information.
- **pmPrintSettings()**: Returns a Core Printing object configured with the print info’s print settings information
- **updateFromPMPageFormat()**: Synchronizes the print info’s page format information with information from its associated page format object.
- **updateFromPMPrintSettings()**: Synchronizes the print info’s print settings information with information from its associated print settings object.
- **takeSettings(from:)**: Updates the print info with all the settings and attributes in the specified PDF info object.

## Constants

- **NSPrintInfo.AttributeKey**: Constants that specify print job attributes.

## Deprecated

- **defaultPrinter**: Deprecated.
- **NSPrintInfo.Orientation**: Constants that specify page orientations.
- **Deprecated Printing Keys**: These keys refer to older printing properties that are no longer used.

## Print Information

- **NSPrinter**: An object that describes a printer’s capabilities.
- **NSPrintOperation**: An object that controls operations that generate Encapsulated PostScript (EPS) code, Portable Document Format (PDF) code, or print jobs.

## Inherits From

- NSObject

## Conforms To

- CVarArg
- CustomDebugStringConvertible
- CustomStringConvertible
- Equatable
- Hashable
- NSCoding
- NSCopying
- NSObjectProtocol
